Update a InfoSection, supports partial update

examples.title: updateInfoSection example for dashboard page code

examples.title: updateInfoSection example for exporting from backend code
body: const result = await elevatedUpdateInfoSection(id, infoSection, options);

members.name: cursor
members.doc:
Pointer to the next or previous page in the list of results.

Pass the relevant cursor token from the `pagingMetadata` object in the previous call's response.
Not relevant for the first request.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Maximum number of items to return in the results.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of items returned in the response.

members.name: cursors
members.doc: Cursor strings that point to the next page, previous page, or both.

members.name: hasNext
members.doc:
Whether there are more pages to retrieve following the current page.

+ `true`: Another page of results can be retrieved.
+ `false`: This is the last page.

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor token pointing to a page of results. Not used in the first request. Following requests use the cursor token and not `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: filter
sort
members.doc:
Sort object in the following format:
`[{"fieldName":"sortField1","order":"ASC"},{"fieldName":"sortField2","order":"DESC"}]`

members.name: next
members.doc: Cursor string pointing to the next page in the list of results.

members.name: prev
members.doc: Cursor pointing to the previous page in the list of results.

members.name: _id
members.doc:
Unique event ID.
Allows clients to ignore duplicate webhooks.

members.name: entityEventSequence
members.doc:
A sequence number defining the order of updates to the underlying entity.
For example, given that some entity was updated at 16:00 and than again at 16:01,
it is guaranteed that the sequence number of the second update is strictly higher than the first.
As the consumer, you can use this value to ensure that you handle messages in the correct order.
To do so, you will need to persist this number on your end, and compare the sequence number from the
message against the one you have stored. Given that the stored number is higher, you should ignore the message.

members.name: entityFqdn
members.doc:
Assumes actions are also always typed to an entity_type
Example: wix.stores.catalog.product, wix.bookings.session, wix.payments.transaction

members.name: entityId
members.doc: ID of the entity associated with the event.

members.name: eventTime
members.doc: Event timestamp.

members.name: originatedFrom
members.doc: If present, indicates the action that triggered the event.

members.name: slug
members.doc:
This is top level to ease client code dispatching of messages (switch on entity_fqdn+slug)
This is although the created/updated/deleted notion is duplication of the oneof types
Example: created/updated/deleted/started/completed/email_opened

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc:
Whether the event was triggered as a result of a privacy regulation application
(for example, GDPR).

members.name: currentEntityAsJson
members.doc:
Since platformized APIs only expose PATCH and not PUT we can't assume that the fields sent from the client are the actual diff.
This means that to generate a list of changed fields (as opposed to sent fields) one needs to traverse both objects.
We don't want to impose this on all developers and so we leave this traversal to the notification recipients which need it.

members.name: assignedProductsCount
members.doc:
Number of products having this info section.
> **Note:** This field is returned only when you pass `fields: "ASSIGNED_PRODUCT_COUNT"` in the request for Get Info Section and Query Info Sections endpoints.

members.name: description
members.doc:
Info section description
In order to use this field you have to integrate with "Ricos" on frontend side. To learn how to do it visit https://ricos.js.org/.

members.name: plainDescription
members.doc:
Optional - RichContent description converted to html.
If provided on write: this description must be a valid html and will be converted to RichContent description.
It is ignored if provided along with RichContent description.

members.name: revision
members.doc: Represents the current state of an item. Each time the item is modified, its `revision` changes by the server. for an update operation to succeed, you MUST pass the latest revision

members.name: title
members.doc: Info section title

members.name: uniqueName
members.doc:
User friendly unique identifier. Customers wont see this
For example, if two info sections have the same title "Return Policy", the unique name must be different: "return-policy-1", "return-policy-2".

description: InfoSection is the main entity of InfoSections

members.name: _id
members.doc: Info section id, if exist - will try get by id

members.name: description
members.doc: Info section description

members.name: plainDescription
members.doc:
HTML or plain text description.
If provided, converted to RichContent description, unless a RichContent description is provided.

members.name: title
members.doc: Info section title

members.name: uniqueName
members.doc:
Info section unique name, if id not provided try get by uniqueName
if not found by unique name - will create new one with given title+description (if exist)

members.doc: A serialized object used for a custom or external link panel.

members.name: rel
members.doc: The HTML `rel` attribute value for the link. This object specifies the relationship between the current document and the linked document.

members.name: target
members.doc:
he HTML `target` attribute value for the link. This property defines where the linked document opens as follows:
`SELF` - Default. Opens the linked document in the same frame as the link.
`BLANK` - Opens the linked document in a new browser tab or window.
`PARENT` - Opens the linked document in the link's parent frame.
`TOP` - Opens the linked document in the full body of the link's browser tab or window.

members.name: url
members.doc: The absolute URL for the linked document.

members.name: backgroundColor
members.doc: The background color as a hexadecimal value.

members.name: paddingBottom
members.doc: The bottom padding value in pixels.

members.name: paddingTop
members.doc: The top padding value in pixels.

members.name: authorName
members.doc: The name of the author or owner of the resource.

members.name: authorUrl
members.doc: The URL for the author or owner of the resource.

members.name: height
members.doc: The height of the resource specified in the `url` property in pixels.

members.name: html
members.doc: HTML for embedding a video player. The HTML should have no padding or margins.

members.name: providerName
members.doc: The name of the resource provider.

members.name: providerUrl
members.doc: The URL for the resource provider.

members.name: thumbnailHeight
members.doc: The height of the resource's thumbnail image. If this property is defined, `thumbnailUrl` and `thumbnailWidth`must also be defined.

members.name: thumbnailUrl
members.doc: The URL for a thumbnail image for the resource. If this property is defined, `thumbnailWidth` and `thumbnailHeight` must also be defined.

members.name: thumbnailWidth
members.doc: The width of the resource's thumbnail image. If this property is defined, `thumbnailUrl` and `thumbnailHeight` must also be defined.

members.name: title
members.doc: Resource title.

members.name: type
members.doc: The resource type.

members.name: url
members.doc: The source URL for the resource.

members.name: version
members.doc: The oEmbed version number.  This value must be `1.0`.

members.name: videoUrl
members.doc: The URL for an embedded viedo.

members.name: width
members.doc: The width of the resource specified in the `url` property in pixels.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Option ID.

members.name: image
members.doc: The image displayed with the option.

members.name: title
members.doc: Option title.

members.name: borderRadius
members.doc: Border radius in pixels.

members.name: enableImage
members.doc: Sets whether to display option images. Defaults to `false`.

members.name: indentation
members.doc: Indentation level from 1-4.

members.name: disableDownload
members.doc: Sets whether the PDF download button is disabled. Defaults to `false`.

members.name: disablePrint
members.doc: Sets whether the PDF print button is disabled. Defaults to `false`.

members.name: viewMode
members.doc:
PDF view mode. One of the following:
`NONE` : The PDF isn't displayed.
`FULL` : A full page view of the PDF is displayed.
`MINI` : A mini view of the PDF is displayed.

members.name: metaSiteId
members.doc: the msid the page is on

members.name: pageId
members.doc: Invalidate by Page ID

members.name: indentation
members.doc: Indentation level from 1-4.

members.name: level
members.doc: Paragraph level

members.name: textStyle
members.doc: Styling for the paragraph text.

members.name: allowMultipleVotes
members.doc: Sets whether one voter can vote multiple times. Defaults to `false`.

members.name: view
members.doc: Sets who can view the poll results.

members.name: vote
members.doc: Sets who can vote.

members.name: autoPlay
members.doc: Sets whether the media will automatically start playing.

members.name: playInLoop
members.doc: Sets whether media's will be looped.

members.name: showControls
members.doc: Sets whether media's controls will be shown.

members.name: alignment
members.doc: The node's alignment within its container.

members.name: height
members.doc: The height of the node when it's displayed.

members.name: spoiler
members.doc: Spoiler cover settings for the node.

members.name: textWrap
members.doc: Sets whether text should wrap around this node when it's displayed. If `textWrap` is `false`, the node takes up the width of its container. Defaults to `true` for all node types except 'DIVIVDER' where it defaults to `false`.

members.name: width
members.doc: The width of the node when it's displayed.

members.name: custom
members.doc: A custom width value in pixels.

members.name: size
members.doc:
One of the following predefined width options:
`CONTENT`: The width of the container matches the content width.
`SMALL`: A small width.
`ORIGINAL`: For `imageData` containers only. The width of the container matches the original image width.
`FULL_WIDTH`: For `imageData` containers only. The image container takes up the full width of the screen.

members.name: custom
members.doc: A custom width value in pixels.

members.name: size
members.doc:
One of the following predefined width options:
`CONTENT`: The width of the container matches the content width.
`SMALL`: A small width.
`ORIGINAL`: For `imageData` containers only. The width of the container matches the original image width.
`FULL_WIDTH`: For `imageData` containers only. The image container takes up the full width of the screen.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Poll ID.

members.name: creatorId
members.doc: Poll creator ID.

members.name: image
members.doc: Main poll image.

members.name: options
members.doc: Voting options.

members.name: settings
members.doc: The poll's permissions and display settings.

members.name: title
members.doc: Poll title.

members.name: containerData
members.doc: Styling for the poll's container.

members.name: design
members.doc: Styling for the poll and voting options.

members.name: layout
members.doc: Layout settings for the poll and voting options.

members.name: poll
members.doc: Poll data.

members.name: options
members.doc: Voting otpions layout settings.

members.name: poll
members.doc: Poll layout settings.

members.name: background
members.doc: Background styling.

members.name: borderRadius
members.doc: Border radius in pixels.

members.name: direction
members.doc: The direction of the text displayed in the voting options. Text can be displayed either right-to-left or left-to-right.

members.name: enableImage
members.doc: Sets whether to display the main poll image. Defaults to `false`.

members.name: type
members.doc: The layout for displaying the voting options.

members.name: fields
members.doc: A list of requested fields to be included in the response.

members.name: fields
members.doc: A list of requested fields to be included in the response.

members.name: query
members.doc: WQL expression

members.name: infoSections
members.doc: The retrieved InfoSections

members.name: pagingMetadata
members.doc: Paging metadata.

members.name: nofollow
members.doc: Indicates to search engine crawlers not to follow the link. Defaults to `false`.

members.name: noreferrer
members.doc: Indicates that this link protect referral information from being passed to the target website.

members.name: sponsored
members.doc: Indicates to search engine crawlers that the link is a paid placement such as sponsored content or an advertisement. Defaults to `false`.

members.name: ugc
members.doc: Indicates that this link is user-generated content and isn't necessarily trusted or endorsed by the pages author. For example, a link in a fourm post. Defaults to `false`.

members.name: documentStyle
members.doc: Global styling for header, paragraph, block quote, and code block nodes in the object.

members.name: metadata
members.doc: Object metadata.

members.name: nodes
members.doc: Node objects representing a rich content document.

members.name: permissions
members.doc: Permissions settings for voting.

members.name: showVoters
members.doc: Sets whether voters are displayed in the vote results. Defaults to `true`.

members.name: showVotesCount
members.doc: Sets whether the vote count is displayed. Defaults to `true`.

members.name: fieldName
members.doc: Name of the field to sort by.

members.name: order
members.doc: Sort order.

members.name: buttonText
members.doc: The text for the button used to remove the spoiler cover.

members.name: description
members.doc: The description displayed on top of the spoiler cover.

members.name: enabled
members.doc: Sets whether the spoiler cover is enabled for this node. Defaults to `false`.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Spoiler ID.

members.name: border
members.doc: Border attributes.

members.name: colors
members.doc: Color attributes.

members.name: borderColors
members.doc: The cell's border colors.

members.name: cellStyle
members.doc: Styling for the cell's background color and text alignment.

members.name: columnHeader
members.doc: Sets whether the table's first column is a header. Defaults to `false`.

members.name: containerData
members.doc: Styling for the table's container.

members.name: dimensions
members.doc: The table's dimensions.

members.name: header
members.doc: Deprecated: Use `rowHeader` and `columnHeader` instead.

members.name: rowHeader
members.doc: Sets whether the table's first row is a header. Defaults to `false`.

members.name: decorations
members.doc: The decorations to apply.

members.name: text
members.doc: The text to apply decorations to.

members.name: decorations
members.doc: The decorations to apply to the node.

members.name: lineHeight
members.doc: Line height for text in the node.

members.name: nodeStyle
members.doc: Padding and background color for the node.

members.name: lineHeight
members.doc: A CSS `line-height` value for the text expressed as a ratio relative to the font size. For example, if the font size is 20px, a `lineHeight` value of `'1.5'`` results in a line height of 30px.

members.name: textAlignment
members.doc: Text alignment. Defaults to `AUTO`.

members.name: placement
members.doc: Thumbnail alignment.

members.name: spacing
members.doc: Spacing between thumbnails in pixels.

members.name: metaSiteId
members.doc: the msid the URI is on

members.name: uriPath
members.doc: URI path to invalidate (e.g. page/my/path) - without leading/trailing slashes

members.name: _createdDate
members.doc: Represents the time this InfoSection was created

members.name: _id
members.doc: InfoSection ID

members.name: _updatedDate
members.doc: Represents the time this InfoSection was last updated

members.name: assignedProductsCount
members.doc:
Number of products having this info section.
> **Note:** This field is returned only when you pass `fields: "ASSIGNED_PRODUCT_COUNT"` in the request for Get Info Section and Query Info Sections endpoints.

members.name: description
members.doc:
Info section description
In order to use this field you have to integrate with "Ricos" on frontend side. To learn how to do it visit https://ricos.js.org/.

members.name: plainDescription
members.doc:
Optional - RichContent description converted to html.
If provided on write: this description must be a valid html and will be converted to RichContent description.
It is ignored if provided along with RichContent description.

members.name: revision
members.doc: Represents the current state of an item. Each time the item is modified, its `revision` changes by the server. for an update operation to succeed, you MUST pass the latest revision

members.name: title
members.doc: Info section title

members.name: uniqueName
members.doc:
User friendly unique identifier. Customers wont see this
For example, if two info sections have the same title "Return Policy", the unique name must be different: "return-policy-1", "return-policy-2".

members.name: fields
members.doc: A list of requested fields to be included in the response.

members.doc: A list of requested fields to be included in the response.

members.doc: The updated InfoSection
